result.execSummary:
All charges against Earl Christopher Yoakum in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Earl Christopher Yoakum is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Christopher Yoakum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Earl Christopher Yoakum.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for jury trial (first call).  On State's Motion, Court ordered case DISMISSED without prejudice.
Defense's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
Defense's Notice of Alibi; received and filed.

Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Earl Christopher Yoakum.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial.  No issues need to be addressed at this time. Defense advised the Notice of Alibi file. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 2. 

Jury Trial scheduled for October 24 , 2022 at 9:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 635 of the Courthouse. ALL PARTIES MUST APPEAR IN-PERSON FOR FIRST CALL.
Received and Filed: Sate's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, appeared in person. Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF1527. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greendale Officer K. Lutomski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, appear by video. Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant is arrested at Racine County Jail. Racine was not able to produce defendant for court today. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Court ordered an Oral No Contact Order with EK (12/29/83); JJG (2/16/44); DP (2/6/83)
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earl Christopher Yoakum appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Earl Christopher Yoakum not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 05-31-2022. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.

Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department requests a signature bond be set as Defendant is hospitalized.  Court GRANTS request.  Case adjourned.  Return on Warrant Initial Appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 in OCCR, Safety Building Room 221.
